jcr:content.jcr:title: Morocco in the Eurovision Song Contest

contentheadline.headline: Morocco in the Eurovision Song Contest

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Eurovision country |Name = Morocco |Flag = Flag of Morocco.svg |Member station = [[Société Nationale de Radiodiffusion et de Télévision|SNRT]](1980) |ESC apps = 1 |ESC first = [[Eurovision Song Contest 1980|1980]] |ESC last = [[Eurovision Song Contest 1980|1980]] |ESC best = 18th: [[Eurovision Song Contest 1980|1980]] |ESC worst = 18th: [[Eurovision Song Contest 1980|1980]] |Website = |EBU page = http://www.eurovision.tv/page/history/by-country/country?country=48 }} '''[[Morocco]]''' entered the '''Eurovision Song Contest''' for the first, and so far only, time at the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1980]] with the song "[[Bitaqat Khub|Bitaqat Hob]]", performed by [[Samira Said|Samira Bensaïd]] in the [[Arabic language]]. ==Participation== The Moroccan broadcaster, [[Société Nationale de Radiodiffusion et de Télévision|Société Nationale de Radiodiffusion et de Télévision (SNRT)]], made the country's debut in 1980, becoming the first African and Arab country to enter the contest while it exploited the fact that [[Israel]] did not participate in the Eurovision Song Contest this year. Their debut entry also marked the first time that Arabic was performed in the contest. Their song for the contest was "[[Bitaqat Khub|Bitaqat Hob]]", performed by famous Moroccan singer [[Samira Said|Samira Bensaïd]]. The song only received 7 points, all from [[Italy in the Eurovision Song Contest|Italy]], and placed 18th, ahead of only [[Finland in the Eurovision Song Contest|Finland]]. ==Withdrawal== After their poor placing in the contest, SNRT announced that they would be withdrawing from the [[Eurovision Song Contest 1981|1981 contest]], and have never returned since. ==Future== A rival Moroccan broadcaster to SNRT, [[2M TV]], has expressed their intention to join the [[European Broadcasting Union]] (EBU). 2M TV, a source of free speech and taboo-breaking in Morocco and for the Moroccan diaspora around [[Europe]], could give the Moroccan people another way of competing at Eurovision. 2M TV, is currently applying for EBU membership and should this be granted, the broadcaster would have the option of entering the contest.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=398|title=Commercial channel interested to join Eurovision Song Contest|date=2007-07-12|publisher=''Oikotimes''|accessdate=2008-10-17}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.esctoday.com/news/read/8972|title=Morocco to return in the next few years?|last=Kuipers|first=Michael|date=2007-07-12|publisher=''ESCToday''|accessdate=2008-09-05}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.oikotimes.com/v2/index.php?file=articles&id=4003|title=Commercial channel interested to join Eurovision Song Contest|date=2008-08-31|publisher=''Oikotimes''|accessdate=2008-09-06}}</ref> == Contestants == {| class="wikitable sortable" |- bgcolor="#ccccff" ! Year ! Artist ! Language ! Title ! Final ! Points |- | [[Eurovision Song Contest 1980|1980]] | [[Samira Said|Samira Bensaïd]] | [[Arabic]] | "[[Bitaqat Khub|Bitaqat Hob]]" (بطاقة حب) | 18 | 7 |- |} ==Voting history== As of {{Escyr|1980}}, Morocco's voting history is as follows: {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! colspan="3"| Most points ''given'' |- ! Rank ! Country ! Points |-bgcolor = "gold" | 1 | {{Esc|Turkey}} | 12 |-bgcolor = "silver" | 2 | {{Esc|Germany}} | 10 |-bgcolor = "#CC9966" | 3 | {{Esc|United Kingdom}} | 8 |- | 4 | {{Esc|Switzerland}} | 7 |- | 5 | {{Esc|Sweden}} | 6 |} {{col-break}} {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! colspan="3"| Most points ''received'' |- ! Rank ! Country ! Points |-bgcolor = "gold" | 1 | {{Esc|Italy}} | 7 |- |} {{col-end}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.eurovisioncovers.co.uk/xtmor.htm Points to and from Morocco] ''eurovisioncovers.co.uk'' {{Morocco in Eurovision}} {{Eurovision Song Contest}} [[Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest]] [[Category:Morocco in the Eurovision Song Contest| ]]
